name: Wholesale and retail sales
description: Within Business and administration, this field is the study of buying and selling goods and services, covering stock management, pricing, loss prevention, sales systems, and current industry trends. It includes the selling of buildings and properties. [cite: 155]

name: Auctioneering
description: The business of selling goods or property by means of auction, studied within Wholesale and retail sales. [cite: 156]

name: Consumer services
description: Relates to services provided directly to consumers, often in a retail context, and is part of Wholesale and retail sales. [cite: 156]

name: Demonstration techniques
description: Skills in effectively showcasing products to potential customers, important in Wholesale and retail sales. [cite: 156]

name: Purchasing
description: The process of acquiring goods or services, often in a business context for resale or use, a key aspect of Wholesale and retail sales. [cite: 156]

name: Real-estate business
description: The buying, selling, and management of properties, including land and buildings, a specialized area within Wholesale and retail sales. [cite: 156, 157]

name: Retailing
description: The sale of goods to ultimate consumers, usually in small quantities, the core of the retail part of Wholesale and retail sales. [cite: 156]

name: Stock-keeping
description: The management of inventory, including ordering, storage, and tracking of goods, essential in Wholesale and retail sales. [cite: 156]

name: Ware-housing
description: The storage of goods in a warehouse, often part of the logistics of Wholesale and retail sales. [cite: 156]

name: Wholesaling
description: The sale of goods in large quantities, typically to retailers for resale, a major component of Wholesale and retail sales. [cite: 156]
